main event: A bright, white, hazy light object was observed flashing red and moving from horizon to horizon over the Pacific on September 15, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 10 seconds at a 10-degree elevation., It flashed red lights and was described as bright and hazy., Initial conclusions suggest the object was possibly a balloon., The sighting was reported from a ground-visual observation., The object changed color from hot blue to dull red before appearing to explode.
sighted object: a bright white hazy light with blue and red modulation
